chapter.p: 1NowOr “And” this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the IsraelitesLiterally “sons/children of Israel” beforeLiterally “to the face of” his death.

ul.li1: “Yahweh came from Sinai,
ul.li2: and he dawned upon them from Seir;
he shone forth from Mount Paran,
ul.li1: and he came with myriads of holy ones,
ul.li2: at his right hand a fiery law for them.This pointing of the MT is very difficult; here HALOT 93 suggests “fire a law for them” as a translation of the compound Hebrew word made up of “fire” + “law,” which I render as “a fiery law”
ul.li1: 3Moreover,Or “Indeed” he loves his people,Literally “a lover of peoples”
ul.li2: all the holy ones were in your hand,
ul.li1: and they bowed down toOr “at” your feet,
ul.li2: each one accepted directions from you.Literally “he takes up from your words”
ul.li1: 4A law Moses instructed for us,
ul.li2: as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
ul.li1: 5And then a king arose in Jeshurun,
ul.li2: at the gathering of the leaders of the people,
united were the tribes of Israel.Literally “together the tribes of Israel”
ul.li1: 6“May Reuben live, and may he not die,
ul.li2: and let his number not be few.”Literally “let he be his people of number”
ul.li1: 7And he said this of Judah,Literally “and this concerning/to Judah, and he said”
“Hear, O Yahweh, the voice of Judah,
ul.li2: and bring him to his people;
ul.li1: his own hands striveOr “is/are great” on his behalf for him,
ul.li2: and may you be a help againstLiterally “from” his foes.”
ul.li1: 8And of Levi he said,
ul.li2: “Your Thummim and your Urim
ul.li1: are for your faithful one,Literally “man, your faithful one”
ul.li2: whom you tested at Massah;Literally “whom you tested him at Massah”
ul.li1: you contended with him
ul.li2: at the waters of Meribah.
ul.li1: 9The one saying of his father and of his mother,
ul.li2: ‘I have not regarded them,’
ul.li1: and his brothers he did not acknowledge,
ul.li2: and his childrenOr “sons” he did not know,
ul.li1: but rather they observed your word,
ul.li2: and your covenant they kept.
ul.li1: 10They taughtOr “teach/will teach” your regulations to Jacob,
ul.li2: and your law to Israel;
ul.li1: they placed incense smoke before you,Literally “in your nose”
ul.li2: and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
ul.li1: 11Bless, O Yahweh, his substance,
ul.li2: and with the work of his hands you must be pleased;
ul.li1: smite the loins of those who attack him,
ul.li2: and those hating him, so that they cannot arise.”Literally “so that not they stand up”
ul.li1: 12Of Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of Yahweh dwells securely,Literally “in confidence”
ul.li2: the Most HighThis is the most likely reading in context (Most High God). Literally the Hebrew text reads “upon him,” so the NASV translates the first line as: dwell in security “by him” shields all around him,
ul.li1: all the day,
ul.li2: and between his shoulders he dwells.”
ul.li1: 13And of Joseph he said,
ul.li2: “Blessed by Yahweh is his land,
ul.li1: withHebrew “from” the choice things of heaven,
ul.li2: withHebrew “from” dew, and withHebrew “from” the deep lying down beneath,
ul.li1: 14and withHebrew “from” the choice things of the fruitsOr “produce of” of the the sun,
ul.li2: and with the choice things of the yield of the seasons,Literally “months”
ul.li1: 15and withHebrew “from” the finest things of the ancient mountains,
ul.li2: and withHebrew “from” the choice things of the eternal hills,Literally “the hills of eternity never ending ages”
ul.li1: 16and withHebrew “from” the choice things of the earth and its fullness,
ul.li2: and the favor of the one who dweltLiterally “dwells” but context puts the event into the past; literally “dweller of the bush” in the bush.Some scholars suggest that this expression must be read as: on Sinai
ul.li1: Let them come to the head of Joseph,
ul.li2: and to the crown of the prince among his brothers.
ul.li1: 17As the firstborn of his ox, majesty belongs to him,Literally “is for him”
ul.li2: and his horns are the horns of a wild ox;
ul.li1: with them he drives people together,Or “all at once” (NASB)
ul.li2: and they are the myriads of Ephraim,
and they are the thousands of Manasseh.”
ul.li1: 18And of Zebulun he said,
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out,
ul.li2: and rejoice, Issachar, in your tents;
ul.li1: 19They summon people to the mountains;Hebrew “mountain”
ul.li2: there they sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness,
ul.li1: because the affluence of the seas they suck out,
ul.li2: and the most hidden treasures of the sand.”Literally “the covered of the hidden of the sand”
ul.li1: 20And of Gad he said,
ul.li2: “Blessed be the one who enlarges Gad;Literally “the enlarger of Gad”
ul.li1: like a lion he dwells,
ul.li2: and he tears an arm as well as a scalp.
ul.li1: 21And he selectedOr “provided” the best part for himself, Hebrew “for him”
ul.li2: for there the portion of a ruler is included,
ul.li1: and he came with the heads of the people;Or possibly, “the heads of the people came/assembled” (compare NEB)
ul.li2: he didOr “worked” the righteousness of Yahweh,
and his regulations for Israel.”
ul.li1: 22And of Dan he said,
“Dan is a cub of a lion;
ul.li2: he leaps from Bashan.”Hebrew “the Bashan,” referring to a well-known geographical and agricultural area
ul.li1: 23And of Naphtali, he said,
“Oh, Naphtali, sated of favor,
ul.li2: and full of the blessing of Yahweh;
ul.li1: take possession of the lake,
ul.li2: and the land to the south.”
ul.li1: 24And of Asher he said,
ul.li2: “Blessed more than sonsLiterally “blessed from/of sons is” features the comparative use the Hebrew preposition min, “than” is Asher;
ul.li1: may he be the favoriteLiterally “may he be favored” of his brothers,
ul.li2: dipping his feet in the oil.Literally “and dipping in the oil his feet”
ul.li1: 25Your bars areOr “will be” iron and bronze,
ul.li2: and as your days, so isOr “so will be/may be” your strength.”
ul.li1: 26“There is no one like God, O, Jeshurun,
ul.li2: who rides through the heavens to your help,
and with his majesty through the skies.
ul.li1: 27The God of ancient timeLiterally “before/earlier times” is a hiding place,
ul.li2: and underneath are the arms of eternity,Or “everlasting ages” or “everlasting arms”
ul.li1: and he drove out from beforeLiterally “from your face” you your enemy,
ul.li2: and he said, ‘Destroy them!’
ul.li1: 28So Israel dwells alone and carefree,
ul.li2: the spring of Jacob in a land of grain and wine;
his heavens even drip dew.
ul.li1: 29Blessed are you, O Israel.
ul.li2: Who is like you, a people who is saved by Yahweh,
ul.li1: the shield of your help,
ul.li2: and who is the sword of your triumph,
ul.li1: and your enemies, they shall fawn before you,Hebrew “to you”
ul.li2: and you shall tread on their backs.”
